Every experience you've had in your life has made you the person you are today.
Those adverse childhood experiences helped you develop grit.
Feeling isolated and bullying in school made you self-sufficient.
Having mental health problems will make you a more empathic physician.

Talk/share your feelings & emotions. Don't feel guilty about it. Remember, you're not alone even most of the time it feels that way.

* It's okay to cry and vent it out.
* It's okay to take 'mental health day' and time off work.
* It's okay to see therapist/psychologist/psychiatrist.
